title: Properties & Methods
subtitle: Object Attributes and Behaviors
description:
# Properties & Methods

Classes have properties (data) and methods (functions). Together, they define what an object knows and what it can do!

## Properties (Attributes)

Data stored in objects:

```python
class Weapon:
    def __init__(self, name, damage):
        self.name = name  # Property
        self.damage = damage  # Property

sword = Weapon("Excalibur", 50)
print(sword.name)  # Access property
print(sword.damage)  # Access property
```

## Methods (Functions)

Actions objects can perform:

```python
class Character:
    def __init__(self, name, health):
        self.name = name
        self.health = health
    
    def take_damage(self, amount):  # Method
        self.health -= amount
        print(f"{self.name} took {amount} damage!")

hero = Character("Hero", 100)
hero.take_damage(20)  # Call method
```

## Your Quest

Enhance the Character class from lesson 10:

1. Add a method called `heal` that takes `amount` as parameter
2. Inside `heal`, add amount to self.health
3. Print "[name] healed [amount] HP!"
4. Create a character with name "Warrior" and health 50
5. Call heal(30) on it
6. Print the character's final health

Expected output:
```
Warrior healed 30 HP!
Final health: 80
```

solutionCode:
class Character:
    def __init__(self, name, health):
        self.name = name
        self.health = health
    
    def heal(self, amount):
        self.health += amount
        print(f"{self.name} healed {amount} HP!")

# Create a character
warrior = Character("Warrior", 50)

# Use the heal method
warrior.heal(30)

# Print final health
print("Final health: " + str(warrior.health))
